revised_title: Tensor Spherical Harmonics for Partial Differential Equations in Mathematical Physics
tldr: The article introduces a new definition for arbitrary-rank cartesian-tensor spherical harmonics, which generalizes numerous known properties of scalar and vector spherical harmonics to the arbitrary-rank case. This method allows for the systematic construction of spectral equations and simplifies the evaluation of integrals of products of three tensor harmonics. The article demonstrates the application of these new tensor harmonics to various partial differential equations in mathematical physics, such as the Laplace and Helmholtz equations, stress-strain equations, and fluid mechanics equations.
